body.name: JOILCAN Phone Tripod Stand, 68" Tripod for iPad iPhone Tablet with Remote Universal Holder Carry Bag, Travel Aluminum Tripod for Video Recording Photos Vlogging Compatible with iPad Pro iPhone Camera

features: 【Versatile Tripod Kit】 Adjustable tablet tripod includes： 1* Aluminum Tripod, 1* Universal Phone / Tablet Holder, 1* Wireless Remote, 1* Carry Bag, and 1* Extra Quick-release Plate. Tripod for iPad is suitable for various shooting occasions, video recording, selfies, Vlogs, photography, live streaming, suitable indoor and outdoor activities

【Wireless Remote Tripod】68" Phone tablet tripod is equipped with wireless remote, which works with cellphones ( IOS 5.0+ and Android 4.3+) and cameras within a distance of 33 ft / 10 m effective range. You can easily connect and quickly response when filming, and don't need to touch your cellphone to start easy selfies, group photos, filming and vlogging.

【Aluminum Tripod & 3-Way Pan Head】 JOILCAN compact tripod is made of high-quality aluminum alloy and non-slip rubber feet provide sturdy support to protect your equipment, and lightweight tripod weighs only 1.68 lbs, and the max load is 9.26 lbs. The 3-way pan head and dual built-in bubble view levels are ideal for precise framing, and the 360-degree swivel functions allow you to easily take superb panoramic shots or switch from portrait to landscape mode.

【Extendable Height Tripod】With 4-stage quick flip locks on the legs, travel tripod's height can easily be adjusted from height 17 inches to 68 inches in a few seconds, it meets different height requirements, for various shooting and photography needs. And portable tripod size with a carry bag, you can easily take it anywhere.

【Tripod for Phone & Tablet】Phone tripod stand with a 2-in-1 universal holder with cold shoe mount, size between 5.1-9.4 inches, compatible with iPad Pro, iPad mini, iPad, iPad Air, SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab, and many other Android tablets. For smartphones like iPhone14 pro max 13/12/11, iPhone X XR XS Max series,Samsung, and other cellphones, etc.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Phone Tripod with Universal Phone Tablet Holder 2 In 1 Phone Tablet Holder: Mini size 5.1 inch, Max size 9.4 inch. With cold shoe mount, suitable for Microphone, fill light, ring light, etc Phone Tripod with Remote Wireless Remote Tripod: works with cellphones ( IOS 5.0+ and Android 4.3+). Fast connect, low energy cost, can continuously take 20000+ photos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iPhone tripod.
reviews.reviewText: Extremely stable, compact tripod for using with a mobile phone to make videos and time lapse photography. Remotre is easy to pair with blue tooth for use in group photographs etc. Well worth the $$.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price
reviews.reviewText: At time of purchase, was less than $20.The tripod does everything i need. I bought & have been using it mainly for my laser level at work. The unit feels cheap, but is sturdy and versatile. It already has quite a bit of use, and just get collapsed and thrown in my tool bag or box at the end of the day.I have used the phone clamp to take some photos of the project, just because i could. Convenient, and also sturdy.It does not have a fine tune height adjustment, but I have found the sliding bar/set screw to be just fine and able to get the spot i need without much fuss (actually quicker than the Bosch unit with fine tune, due to the wide "clicks" or the rack/gear on the bosch)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars good starter, light and packable, great for hikes and bike rides.
reviews.reviewText: my first tripod, lots of adjustments and sturdy. light enough to topple over in wind though. started using the center hook to hold my bags and weight it down. blue color is sharp and reflects enough light at night you won't walk into the legs. packs up short and light so can easily tuck into any bag or backpack for easy carrying on a trail or bike ride. once little twitch though once you move it from level it's tough to get it all the way back to level again. it's just off a little. frustrating but not enough to return it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice economy tripod for an iPhone
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for YouTube videos and it does a good job. No problems at all. Lightweight, durable, easy to adjust.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The stand is a good quality product. I especially enjoy the remote feature.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice lightweight tripod.
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is so light, compact and seems sturdy enough to hold my iPad while I film my son’s sporting events. The panning action is also really smooth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Searched hard for my 2nd Joilcan, and really pleased as expected
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Joilcan tripod. I researched really hard the first time, and was looking for the best 70+" tripod, as I am relatively tall and wanted it to be close to my own point of view. It was tough because I noticed a surprisingly big price jump around the 60-70" level (I guess hard to stabilize right around there?). Joilcan had amongst the highest reviews of those with reasonable prices (I didn't want the stratospheric $100 or even $75 ones). I also liked the beautiful colors, as I got mine in an exciting blue instead of boring black. I clocked that one in around $40. Been using it for over a year and pretty pleased.I came back to AMZN for a second one this BF thinking I could use a portable one to throw in the stroller. I had recently used a cheapie selfie stick/tripod in the park and the wind blew it over and scratched up my phone, not to mention many pictures were slightly slanted because of the wind. So stability was high on my list. I saw a really good deal for $8 on a lightweight (1.1lb?) tripod, but some reviews said it blew in the wind as well. So I kept going. OMG! There was my great friend Joilcan, which I already loved. Actually, I had searched for Joilcan first, knowing I already trusted the brand, but for some reason AMZN only brought up the very tall 70+" expensive ones again, and this time I wanted a cheaper one as it was just for temporary usage. I couldn't believe it, not only did I find the 65" I was looking for at a much cheaper price than my 72", but in fact it was another half off (remember, it was BF). Most importantly, it still weighs in at 2.8lbs, much more stable than the other 1 and change tripods I saw. Like my first one, I got it in my color (blue), but unlike my first one (or the cheaper model I saw before), it also included a clicker -- which I wanted, since my last one wasn't working well. I jumped on the deal, and the rest is history. The product is as good as the original one, just a few inches shorter. My only small beef is that it's hard to fold it correctly to fit back in the carrying case. But, I only tried once so far, I'm sure I'll get it next time...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, quick to pull out, and not a burden to carry
reviews.reviewText: So far it's very sturdy! All the legs come out smoothly and are very easy to put up in a hot second. You can adjust the head swivel or tilt it have your camera in any orientation you want and lock it in. You can even have the lock at halfway so that the swivel go smoothly yet firmly, or have it completely unlocked and it will go very smoothly. There's a hook at the bottom to put weight on it, but I don't think you need weight in a breeze. This is heavy enough to stand on its own in wind, but is very light to carry around without wearing you out. There's a gauge on the side that tells you if you are level or not, but you won't need it because the head is so adjustable and can lock in the camera at whatever orientation YOU see is levelled. This is my first tripod, and I need it for long exposures, like sunsets, waterfalls, astrophotography. This is a quality sturdy product that will last thru wind and be quick to set up in the heat of the moment. I like that it's sturdy and can tighten the camera so it wont fall over on the stand which was the problem with my hand me down

Lets be honest here for $35 you cant expect the moon. It works as advertised but is a little flimsy. Apply a little too much pressure or bend something the wrong way and it will break. The remote works with blue tooth and connects without much effort. You can pay many hundreds or more for something strong and sturdy, this is not it.
As described. Height is very good, tilt works too. haven't tried with my mirrorl3ss yet but worked well with smartphone.

I got this tripod to use on digital camera to take pictures of hobby kits in a light box. Also to mount a pair of 15 by 70 binoculars. Tripod is mostly plastic so not recommended for heavy telescopes. Works well for my intended uses. Would recommend it for these types of use. Also it is light weight so taking it on a hiking trip is fine. Folds up into a small light package. I would buy it again.

This tripod is sturdy enough and does the job for my self-tapes with my phone. As others have mentioned, you need to be careful with it because it's made a bit flimsy.As long as you are gentle, I think it will last a long time.I just wish the phone holder was a twist for tightening instead of a stretch clamp. I feel like that may break sooner.Overall happy with it, and it's price.

Product doesn't have exact product instructions. I follow the instructions somehow one part was broken already and i try to install. And the upper stand of camera is not steady its moving even after mounting. Overall somewhat satisfied.
